intro: Bossiaea dasycarpa, commonly known as the dense-fruited bossiaea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant produces capsule fruits that are densely covered in hairs, giving it its specific epithet "dasycarpa." It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in heathlands and woodlands. Bossiaea dasycarpa is often found in the southeastern regions of Australia, including New South Wales and Victoria.
